title: Why do i get leaverbusted because my game crashed?
body: I was waiting for the game to load , until i got the error message that i had to check my internet connection ( which was fine). Soi restarted and League repaired itself. So far so good. I go back in and see that they obviously surrendered. I then find out i got the leaverbuster ban because my game crashed. I mean getting punished for something i didnt even do is not ok.

replies.body: Even if your leave is not intentional, [leaverbuster](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ) treats all leaves equally because they still cause a negative experience for others.  Your best bet is to resolve whatever is causing you to leave.  I'd love to help but need more info and specifics on what your crashing issue is, along with any errors.  Let me know!
Really sucks that the buster can't tell the freaking difference between a crash and a quit. It's a painintheass when you get a BSOD and get punished for something you can't prevent or fix.

Players intentionally leaving are likely to get banned.  The lower priority queue is to give you time to troubleshoot whatever is causing you to leave, or prevent that possibility from happening again.  I know it's frustrating to receive a leaverbuster penalty, but it sucks just as much for 9 other players who are down a player.  We have many guides and are always happy to help troubleshoot.  Check out our [Knowledge Base](https://support.riotgames.com), you might find that many issues are indeed fixable or let me know if you're having a specific issue.

It treats all 'equally'' ,  so shall we treat thieves just like rapists now? You treat the innocent guys like the ones that just straight up left. All that I saw was the game closing and telling me ''LoL crashed''. Also to troubleshoot for errors sounds good, especially 4 more times after i had found the bug or it fixed itself. So I can quadra check for an fixed error. If i want to search for errors I close League of Legends, and take my bloody time.
